title: Cumin-Scented Stir-Fried Beef with Celery
summary: Cumin-Scented Stir-Fried Beef with Celery is a gluten free and dairy free main course. This recipe serves 1 and costs $3.15 per serving. One serving contains 348 calories, 36g of protein, and 18g of fat. Head to the store and pick up celery ribs, cornstarch, garlic, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the ginger you could follow this main course with the Ginger Cake with Crystallized Ginger Frosting as a dessert. Not a lot of people made this recipe, and 1 would say it hit the spot. With a spoonacular score of 69%, this dish is pretty good. Similar recipes are How to cook: Stir fried beef with celery and ginger, Cumin-Scented Stir Fry, and Spicy Stir-Fried Fennel, Celery, and Celery Root With Chinese Sausage.
instructions: Preparation                                                        Halve steak lengthwise if large. Slice across the grain about 1/8 inch thick.                                                                Toss beef with 1/2 teaspoon soy sauce, 1/4 teaspoon cornstarch, and a pinch of salt.                                                                Stir together rice wine, remaining 2 teaspoon soy sauce, and remaining 1/4 teaspoon cornstarch.                                                                Heat wok over high heat until smoking, then pour 1 teaspoon oil down side and swirl to coat. Add beef in 1 layer and cook, turning occasionally, until browned, less than 1 minute. Transfer to a bowl.                                                                 Add remaining teaspoon oil to wok, then add ginger, garlic, cumin, and red-pepper flakes and stir-fry 15 seconds. Add celery and stir-fry 1 minute, then add beef and juices and stir-fry 15 seconds. Stir rice-wine mixture, then pour into wok and stir-fry until sauce is bubbling, about 30 seconds. Remove from heat and stir in celery leaves.                                                Serve with:              steamed white rice                                                         Per serving: 410 calories, 22 g fat (6 g saturated), 58 mg cholesterol, 896 mg sodium, 8 g carbohydrates, 2 g fiber, 37 g protein                            Nutritional analysis provided by                                        Nutrition Data                                                                        See Nutrition Data's complete analysis of this recipe â€º

steps.step: Halve steak lengthwise if large. Slice across the grain about 1/8 inch thick.
Toss beef with 1/2 teaspoon soy sauce, 1/4 teaspoon cornstarch, and a pinch of salt.
Stir together rice wine, remaining 2 teaspoon soy sauce, and remaining 1/4 teaspoon cornstarch.
Heat wok over high heat until smoking, then pour 1 teaspoon oil down side and swirl to coat.
Add beef in 1 layer and cook, turning occasionally, until browned, less than 1 minute.
Add remaining teaspoon oil to wok, then add ginger, garlic, cumin, and red-pepper flakes and stir-fry 15 seconds.
Add celery and stir-fry 1 minute, then add beef and juices and stir-fry 15 seconds. Stir rice-wine mixture, then pour into wok and stir-fry until sauce is bubbling, about 30 seconds.
Remove from heat and stir in celery leaves.
